text: Fruity sourish funky beginning. Malty hops, dry sourish funky. Moderate sourish hoppy malts. Funky sour aftertaste.

Rating 20.000. Bottle shared with Koelschtrinker. Leuchtend trübes hell goldgelbes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch ist mild säuerlich, fruchtig, hefig, helle Früchte. Geschmack ist mild säuerlich, spritzig fruchtig, hefig, limetten, super.
Weich karbonisierter, geringfügig säuerlicher Antrunk. Steigende Intensität, die Säure bleibt angenehm gering, süffig, rund, kaum bitter. Gut. 10/11/10/10/11/10

How: Draught.
Where: Omnipollos hatt, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, spices, a bit sour, yeast, a bit floral.
Body: Light body, medium to high carbonation.
Flavour: Citrus, yeast, spices, sour, grapefruit, some tart.

Draught at Hatten. 
Pours hazy yellow with a white head. 
Aroma of lemon and hay. 
Lots of lemon sweet and sourness, some grape peel and very refreshing!
Draught @ Omnipollos hatt. Lavish saison with high tartness, a flowery sweetness and heavy notes of wine. Crisp and tart. A bit too frizzante.
Draught. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of citrus, vinegar. Taste is sour with notes of wine. Refreshing!
2014 vintage at Fofa in 2016. It had a fruity nose of wildflowers, honey jelly and fresh mown hay. Very dry with notes of honey and berries. Really delicious with an ultra-soft and smooth body.

Bottle-thanks to a friend in DC for the bottle 
Pours slightly hazy yellow hue with a small fizzy spritzy soda white head with hardly any lacing. Nose is slightly spicy, lots of lemon grass, honey, lite husky pale grains. decent. Flavors are tart, tangy, lightly grassy, lots of lemon tartness, mild sweetness and some lightly husky malt backbone. very clean brew. Not overly complex but definitely tasty nonetheless. I would have to say even though i will be giving this brew a decent score, It is a bit over-hyped from what i can gather.

Draught @ The Oath. Cloudy pale yellow with small frothy off-white head, lime aroma, high carbonation, lightly sour medium bitter taste with lavender like flavor, smooth body, longish lightly sour finish. Very nice and complex taste.

Pours a hazy yellow/golden color with a large white head and lot of carbonation bubbles. Nose of tart citrus, a bit of bread, yeast nose as well. Taste is a nice dry finish a bit of tartness, quite refreshing. You get a bit of the honey near the middle of the drink. dry finish. High carbonation. Very good
2015 bottle. Yellow with a white head. Nose is honey, earth, lightly tart and florals. Great palate, florals up front, honey, earth, amazingly smooth finish

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Drinked at omnipollo?s hatt. At the nose mineral notes, some Amalfi lemons peels. In mouth is light bodied very refreshing, lemony juice flavours. A bit of sourness and saltiness very enjoyable.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey during the Hill Farmstead tap takeover on 4/1/2017. Not an April Fools Joke. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of funk, floral, citrus. Tastes of citrus, floral notes, funk, light tartness. Medium body with a dry finish. Great saison.

Bottle from an ancient trade. Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Nose is som emu k, wheat, bread, mild citrus, and. A bit of funk. Flavor is similar with bread, lactic, light funk, citrus, and cobweb with a hint of dry yeast. Finish dries it right out with lingering tart citrus and yeast. Light to medium in body and very nice overall.
Słodki dosyć, kwiatowy aromat. Mega rustykalne, brettowe, skórzaste. Znów subtelna, elegancka, cudna kwasowość. Wyśmienite piwo.
Sampel na panelu w chmielarni na Marszałkowskiej. W aromacie bretty, kwiaty i słodycz, pięknie pachnie. Smak naprawdę leciutko kwaśny, wytrawny ale z lekką słodyczą i kremowością. Super.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Panel #3 Rami Rami is drinking an Anna (2/25/16) by Hill Farmstead Brewery at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaSlodkie brety, jakies owoce, kwiatki, smak kwasno-slodki, troche sciaga, klasa, acz imho arturowi ustepuje chocby pijalnoscia. duuzo bretowOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
750ml bottled 2016-11-30. Pour pale yellow minimal foam. Aroma is acitic and lactic. Taste is wheat sour snd salty. Medium to high carbonation. Long acid and bitter

Pours a golden color with a carbonated white foam head. The aroma is of sour dough, grains, sugar, floral hops, lemon, and yeast. Tasting had a tart and sweet bread taste. There was a clean but simple bitterness. The yeast had a noticeable lemon saison like taste. Overall this brew is very flavorful, drinkable, and had a pleasant bitterness.
Bottle at RBBest. Pours pale yellow. Aroma is light vinegar, honey. Body continues like that, tart, sour and crisp. Some vinegar again, with a medium flowery palate.

Bottle at 2017 Ratebeer Best. Pours clear, bright gold. White head. Mild aroma suggesting apple. Flavor is mild sour, almost acidic. Its a little citrus for me. Very smooth and light funk. Quite delicious.
On tap@: pours yellow/straw haze eith tiny off-white head. Aroma-flavors: grapes, white bread, hint of honey..some citruses, genle spicy notes. Body is moderate, texture soft, carbonation is medium.

750ml bottle @ Alexs. Bottled 2016.02
Pours a hazy golden yellow colour with a small off-white head. Nose is light brett with a wet grass and some citrus notes. Flavour is light zesty lemon which lends to the light sourness and tartness. In the after taste I get some trace amounts of honey.

Sergeys hunt; bottled 2016 02 2x (cut)Hazy blond color, medium head. The aroma is deep, manure, citrus peel. Smooth mouthfeel, rather dry; it has a good blend of spicy yeast and orange peel, with a white wine sourness in the final, and not even much astringent.Excellent.
750ml bottle (thx, Alex L.!) at Alexs. Bottled 2016-02-??. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is funky, some spices and slight honey notes. Same taste. Crispy, dry. Good.

Golden clear liquid, small white lacing. Aromas are zesty, lemon, brett, herbal hops. It really taste like heaven, one of the best saison Ive tasted, taste is medium sour/tartness, lemon, honey, small barnyard notes. Quite dry with a light sweetness, very very good.

Bottle. Appearance: light, rather clear yellow. Smell: nice brett, citrus, and subtle hops aromatic. Taste: unique use of bretts, balanced with citrus, and subtle barnyard notes. Unique combination between texture and feel, perhaps thanks to honey. Moderate to high dryness, moderately sour, high drinkability. Overall: Hill Farmstead.

Bottle Sharing / Piwne Degustacje Kraków, Craftownia - Krakowski Wielokran  

Kolor blado żółty. Piwo jest mętne. Bardzo ładna biała jak snieg piana, która długo się utrzymuje.
W aromacie skórka cytryny, pomarańcze, ananas, delikatna kolendra.
Z tyłu mnóstwo nut kwiatowych, fenolowych. Sporo przypraw, trochę trawy i siana.
W smaku rześkie, cytrusowe, lekko kwaśne. Niewielki stopień dzikości, funky.
Dalej wchodzą przyprawy, z których na prowadzenie wysuwa się silny goździk.
Po ogrzaniu pokazuje się obiecywany miód kwiatowy. Średnie ciało. Owocowe, wytrawne. Bardzo bogate piwo. Mega orzeźwiające i sesyjne!

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2017 Just when you think it can not get any better along comes this Saison, with its layers of interlocking and slowly unraveling brilliance, perfectly weighted on the tongue for an unparalleled drinking experience. A-triple plus.

750ml bottle purchased at Hill Farmstead. Pours a beautiful hazy yellow, slightly gold, thick frothy white head leaving substantial lacing all over. Smells winey, sweet, honey and lemony fruits. Tastes winey, sour, little sweet honey and lemon bitterness. Small malts and tiny hoppy bitterness. Smooth tarty mouthfeel. Light but consistent. Good beer. Not my favorite of Hills shelf saisons but still great.

Pours a golden yellow with a white lacing. Aroma is lemon, baryard, vinegar, Greek yogurt, honey and mineral water. The water quality shines through. The flavor is moderately tart and this beer is thoroughly quenching

Poured from a bottle into a tulip: Pours hazy golden with a one finger head. Aroma of citrus, grass, honey, and saison funk. Nice mild sweetness from the honey, lots of herbal grassy notes, soft medium body, very tasty.
750ml bottle. Pours out a hazy golden topped with a white head. Nose is nice citrus notes spice and some light cereal malt. Taste is more of the nice tartness citrus and a light malt.
Very balanced and beautiful beer. Literally tasted handcrafted if that makes sense... very well made and my favorite FarmHouse Ale

Bottle pour at Shelton Brothers. Funky nose with lemon zest and touch of honey. Clean and crisp on the palate. Great carbonation with a well-rounded mouthfeel. More citrus, and funk with a touch of honey. Crisp and dry finish.

750 ml bottle 
Pours a yellow gold with moderate head.
Aromas of tart funk, lemons, and fruit candy.
Flavors follow same with nice refreshing tartness.

Bottles at Shelton Bros The Festival.
Head is small, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy light yellow.
Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (herbs), with notes of sour apple, oak, lemon zest.
Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.
Light to medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately astringent.


Pretty similar quality to other HF brews Ive had...sourish and generic, but reasonably decent for that sort of thing I guess. Got two big pours but it just doesnt have any magic. Six strikes for HF...can I call them out yet? Surprisingly no line whatsoever for this either time I went for a pour, so even beer bros dont seem to be clamoring for it.

Golden colour, white head. Aroma of honey, yeast, warm yeast and malts. Malty flavour, citrus, light sour, light sweet note. Sour finish, malts and honey.(from 75cL bottle @ RBBSG IV, the Hot and Sweaty Edition, Gent 2015. Thanks for sharing, Youri!)

Pours golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is citrus, earthy, light funk, honey and floral. Taste is moderate bitters with a touch of sweetness. Medium bodied, though it drinks lighter. Excellent saison.

750mL. Pours a hazy bright yellow with a moderate white head. Aroma is honey, flowers, yeast, grass, and funk. Taste is tart and tangy lemon, peach, yeast, wheat, light honey, and little bit of spice. Some grassy hops in the tart finish. Light body. Fizzy, medium carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel. Mouthfeel is crisp rather than creamy and no where near as strong without the yeast sediment.

Une bière blonde, trouble, aux teints dorés avec peu de carbonatation. Au nez, beaucoup de levures sauvages, une présence sucrée, et la fameuse levure saison spécialité de HF. En bouche, ce qui me frappe au départ, cest lespèce de goût de pastille contre la toux au miel. La finale est sèche, avec peu damertume. Un petit peu des levures sauvages sont remarquables, mais en arrière-plan. Au final cest assez équilibré, mais sans être grandiose.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing well filtered neon yellow with 1.5 fingers of clean white foam. 

The nose shows sharp tart notes with notes of brett in between. 

The palate fully carbonated and light bodied. Light maltiness with a medium tartness throughout. A bit one dimensional.
Very citrusy saison. Some bretta grapefruit. Hazy yellow pour with good head and lacing. Light tangy finish. Well balanced.

750 ml bottle from trade with bytemesis. Thank you Mike! Hazy pale yellow golden color with white head. Yeasty, hoppy and malty aroma, spicy, light funky, grassy, citrusy fruity, some honey notes. Sweet, light acidic and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with average carbonation.

Bottle shared thanks to RandomstrangerNL. Hazy pale yellow golden with white head. Lemon, wheat flour, gooseberries, soft mineral water, funk, fresh cut grass, a hint of lactic notes, soft flowery notes on the nose, light unripe apricot. Almost medium sour and light sweet. Almost medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation.
Bottle shared. Hazy lemon yellow with a white head. Notes of lemon, light brett, herbal hops, lemon zest, lemonade, aspirin. Light body, dry and refreshing, bitter-sweet and perfectly balanced.

Pours bright yellow with a foamy white head that slowly reduces to a ring and film. Sparse, delicate lacing. Nose is tart with some barnyard funk; notes of straw and grass; grapefruity citrus. Taste is mildly sour and slightly dry on the finish. Light body, fine carbonation. Very nice brew!
Bottle at Liquid Sunshine. Hazy pale, soapy foam, cloudy grapefruit. Sweet grapefruit. So lovely, soft sour, great aroma. Pretty darn tasty.

Bottle, 75cl. It pours an almost clear body and a golden color, with a dense, white finger-thick head. Its very fruity on the nose, with some peppery saison yeast, a light funky hint, some flower I guess is from the honey and then some more fruityness. Some bitterness in the mouth, with hints of oranges. Peppery yeast, flower notes and a wee malty touch in the flavor. Its dry and pleasantly carbonated, with a lasting finish of tropical fruits, peppery yeast hints, bitterness, flower and honey. Nothing but delicious. 160102

Draught at WarPigs Brewpub, Hill Farmstead Day. Patchy head, hazy golden-orange body, spotty lacing. Spiced fruity aroma with matching tartness. Gooseberry and citrus to the taste profile followed by citrus peels towards a lingering finish. Fine bodied. Pleasant and refreshing (shared with KimJohansen and Skinnyviking, Copenhagen 12.05.2016).

Draught at Warpigs at the courtesy of Rune. Low fluffy lasting white quickly disappearing head. Cloudy yellow body. Acidic lemon grapefruit grass aroma and flavor but also sweet notes of honey and herbs. Low carbonation. Long finish.
Tap @Warpigs. A classic saison, honey colored with hay/barnyard and yeasty taste, but with citrus funk and just so clean, like most HF beers. Excellent.
On tap at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Fruity and spicy with a fresh herbal aroma. Similar taste. Light tart. Very refreshing and very nice! Love the fresh herbal aroma.

Slightly yellow orange in color... Aroma of honey, tropical fruits, earthy grains, hay, funk, oak.. Flavor is honey, grains, lemon, citrus, oak, funk... Amazing 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at warpigs. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits and floral. Yeasty notes of brett.The flavours is mainly medium sour but finish light bitter with lingering hoppyness and peppery.

From tap at Warpigs, Hill Farmstead Day. it pours hazy golden with a white head. Great juicy aroma. Light acidic. Floral and fruity hoppy. Citrusy and floral hoppy flavor with a decent amount of zesty bitterness. Quenching acidity. Bretty. Lighter honey notes. Brilliant.
Bottle poured at Toms. Cloudy lemon color with a thick fizz head. Sour citrus fruit and straw aroma. Flavor is floral, citrus fruit, low tart. Cool finish. Complex, and most excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2016 Bottle at Liquid tasting in Seattle-USA. Cloudy honey pour, little lacing foam. Nose: brett, lime, honey a bit. Mouth: tart a bit, nice grapefruit. Re-taste: Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà in Rome-Italy with Mortlach. Clear golden super bright color, foam has retention and leaves drafts. Nose: lime, herbs, much lemon grass. Mouth: lovely! Clean, crisp, citric, lemony.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - flowers, wild yeast - funk, barnyard, and wheat.
Appearance - the body color is a hazy maize yellow. The head color is white and it is rocky and well over 2+". The head very slowly settles. Great wispy lace spirals.
Taste - there is a fine composite here. Wheat, coriander, wild yeast, and some lightly pungent hops buried tastefully below. There is also a wild floral element. Overall the impression comes off as - slightly tart, little salt, and a slight bit sour. There is some funk, a bit of barnyard. Very interesting being this is a saison.
Palate - medium body, champagne-like texture, the carbonation lively, the finish is dry and effervescent.
KRS/KØLF 020116. Golden-yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, fruit, spices, yeast. Flavour is yeast, lemon,lime, citrus, funk, fruit, spices, flowers. Very nice beer.

Prufrockstar continues to come through with Hill Farmstead bottles. Not quite sure why he shares, but Im more than happy to take advantage! 

Light yellow pour, white fluffy head. Absolutely spectacular aroma. Fresh fields and light grapefruit -- delicious. Could almost be a 10; Ill give it a 9. Flavor is delightful as well. Just the faintest sweet grassy elements, again gently sour but not strongly so, nice minerally and almost sulferic flavors running gently and well-balanced beneath. Superb.
Bottle. Pours clear amber with a nice off white head. Aroma is funky sour citrucy grainy as us flavor. Very nice.
A: Cloudy yellow with a white head that disappears fast. N: Yeast, hay, mango T: Lemon, starfruit, mango O: Nice balance of sweet and tart. Refreshing!
Its Anna, its lightly tart, its lightly sweet, its a bit grainy, its drinkable as hell, its good beer as usual.
[1/31/16] Bottle sample at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Hazy yellow. Fruity esters, wood, wine. Dry, tart, bitterish, light astringency. Medium-bodied. Very good.

Lucky to live in northern California. In Sunnyvale, Olsons Cherries grows Blenheim apricots that are nearly dry-farmed, as are the Crane melons grown by the Crane Melon Barn in the black soil of Santa Rosa. Over on the coast in Davenport, Swanton Berry Farm is still growing Chandler strawberries. And Andy Mariani in Morgan Hill is the only orchardist in America I know of who grows the original "un-improved" green gage (reine claude) plum. So I have serious doubts about the deliciousness of the fruit varietals that are hardy enough to grow in the chilly climes of Vermont. Not so Vermont honey. This Bière de Miel rightly deserves the myriad accolades it has received. Had it at the RateBeer Best Festival.
Pour from bottle at rate beer festival 2016. Pours yellow straw. Taste is some lemon an straw barn yard. Dry with a slight sweet finish at the end.
Bottle. Pours light yellow with nice white head. Nose is some honey and floral. Taste is kind of dry but then sweet honey and a little funk. Great.

750 ml bottle. Clear pale golden to yellow body with a small white head. Delicate aroma of citric fruit, mild lemon, grapes and spicy yeast. Flavor is refreshing fruity, mild lemon, spicy yeast, mild bitterness, light soft malt, hint of wood, quite dry and just a faint hint of funky sourness. Perfect balanced body and long lasting nice aftertaste. Super complex in a rather subtle way, incredible balanced all the way and very tasty and moorsih. Dont realty find any honey flavor here but I dont miss it either.
Aroma of lemon and some dirty socks. Pretty tart flavored and makes you pucker. Definitely one of the better saisons. Pours light yellow with a white head. Thanks kasers
Bright yellow a little cloudy, poured from 22oz bottle at home. Flowery lemon aroma. A little sour kick to it. Pickles. Dry and carbonated. Pretty tasty atudf

Bottle, courtesy of yngwie. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of lemon, wildflower, funk, some yeast and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and sour with some lemon, peach, malt and herbs. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. Willeys Store, Greensboro, VT. Hazy, green tinged, straw colour. Skim of shape making, white head. Nose has lemon juice. Some damp grain. Some lemongrass. Hints of yeasty funk. Toasty malts. Faint note of honey, but maybe because Im looking for it. Taste is crisp, lightly tart, and light bitter. Palate is crisp and dry. The tart dryness turns lightly sour on the finish. The honey element has mostly passed me by, although Im happy with that. More of the crisp, lemon tartness on the finish.

Bottle 750ml @ My parents place
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, citrus, tartness, funk, floral and grassy. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter and light to medium sour with a long dry, tart, citrus, funky and floral finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft to fizzy.

Bottle at home. Excellent looking Saison with a slightly cloudy appearance from the wheat malt and a big, pillowy white head. The flavor is brett funk and a noticeable sourness from the yeast, and it has a reasonably full mouthfeel from the honey. Another fantastic saison from Hill Farmstead.

Bottle: Thanks Pushkinwow: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Light gusher and foam snake that kept coming.
Hazy yellow body. Airy yet sticky white head.
Aroma is wheat, funky, light vanilla, yeast, clean white wood, 
Flavour is crispy mix of tartness, wheat, hint of grapes and lemon, some hops and herbs, wood, yeast, light dry... Good fresh fruity and light tart.
Aftertaste is light tart, fruity, light dry, and hints of funk and wood.
Low to medium carbo, light water light creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.

text: Great saison. Its light, spicy and fruity, easily drinkable but very flavorful with a complex brett character. Not a surprise if you are familiar with the brewer but thats not always a bad thing.
Bottle shared at Darkness day. Clear light golden pour. Funky basement aroma. Taste is wheat and grass, light and drinkable. Good stuff.
Fantastic bright citrus and saison-spiciness on nose. Palate is bright, crisp, and citrus. Beautiful bright yellow with white head.

Bottle. Poured a bright yellow, mainly clear, foamy white head. Aroma of funk and tartness, straw, citrus. Flavor had mild honey notes, lemon, funk, and straw. Loved the sour notes. Light body, sticky texture, bubbly carbonation, crisp and dry finish. Very good.

Location: 750 ml bottle from the brewery, 11/15/15, Rating #5000! Wow, thats a lot of ticks. Seemed only fitting to consume this one the way so many of the previous were: sitting around on a Sunday watching football.


Aroma: The aroma is funky and fruity, some pepper/spice, floral, and honey notes

Appearance: It pours a clear golden color with a sheeting white head and coating lace

Flavor: Tastes funky, tart, and a little sweet. The yeasty spice component comes through on the close. Theres kind of a bright floral / honey component that doesnt necessarily change the underlying flavor but adds a nice complimentary piece to the overall flavor of this beer.

Palate: This beer feels quite bright and refreshing on the mouth, with an average to lively carbonation, and a lasting, somewhat dry finish. Extremely drinkable at 6.5%.

Overall Impression: 
Another excellent Hill Farmstead beer. Everything is just really well put together here. Its not a mind blowing beer, instead, its a work of fine craftsmanship. One of those beers that proves how sometimes simplicity is the best path to brilliance, which is one of those things thats true in most of the culinary arts, but something we take for granted too often.

This review is really about that rating number though. 5000 ratings in the 8ish years Ive been rating (and the almost 7 Ive been active in the site - sadly, I have to admit I originally learned of the site and began tracking my ratings through the RateBeer Facebook app that existed for a while back in 08) feels crazy to me.  I feel like Im a pretty active rater, but Ill never get close to that multiple thousand per year level that others manage to achieve. Anyway, very excited to hit this level. Thanks to RateBeer for turning this from a hobby into something more. Glad to have used this site to reconnect with old friends, turn others into beer obsessives, and make new ones. Thanks to everyone Ive shared one of those 5k with, its been a pleasure, and Im looking forward to the next 5k.

Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy pale yellow color with a fizzy white head. Aroma is dry, yeasty, light funk, light tartness. Flavor is much more tart than their other shelf saisons. Definitely my favorite of the bunch.
Hazy light yellow pour with a white head. Sour, wheat, funk grass. Really nice saison. Slight bitter finish.
Bottle. Hazy light yellow pour with a white head. Funky, lemony, bright and spritzy. This is terrific.
Very nice and refreshing. Nicely tart and dry. This is way better than any lemonade on a hot day.

Bottle at Lan Xin and Sandras. Pours a hazy yellow with a tiny white head. Sweet and tart with lemony aromas with hints of honey and dust. Medium bodied. Medium to lively carbonation. Long dry finish with floral notes.

750ml bottle shared by dmac! Thanks bro! Pours a clear golden color with a long lingering white foamy head. Aroma of funk, green apple, grain, hints of plastic, and some saison yeast. Taste of grain, grass, green apple, funk, and lemon lime citrus.

750ml bottle from jblaze, thanks Pedro. Poured a golden body with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma is funky, lemons, flowers, hint of honey, barnyard. Flavor is super funky, green apple, old lemon, straw, hay, flowers. Body is medium with lively carbonation and a lingering funky aftertaste.

Saison #100. Bottle from the brewery, date 03/15. Pours medium yellow beige with a white head. Aroma is honey, grass, HFS funk. Flavor is soft and smooth, honey, wheat, mild lemon acidity, a bit of grassy bitterness, HFS funk.

Aroma of bubblegum, light pineapple, hay, earthy hop quality with a bit spice. Taste is very refreshing, ever so light tartness with a subtle grass, very light and with nice typical saison yeast notes, very dry but a bit unpleasant soap like bitter aftertaste.

From notes. Found a lost page from a tasting with Eric and Haley on April 24! Poured from a 750 mL bottle. The pour is a golden yellow color with a large, fizzy white head and some good legs of lace. The aroma is surprisingly good. There is a lot of lemongrass with this one. A good grassy note balances with the citrus and a pretty strong wheat. The wheat isnt traditionally Belgian, which is what I was expecting from a saison. The flavors are a little sweeter than I would predict. There is a nice honey presence to accompany the citrus and a good spiciness brings up the rear. Its definitely a style I think I need to try to get used to. The mouth feel is thin, crisp, and carries a large carbonation with it. The aftertaste is grassy, wheaty, and offers a little spice with it on the finish. Not too bad.

Robe blonde pâle légèrement trouble, col de mousse mince, soyeux et léger. Une dentelle moyennement mince et huileuse. Arômes de citron, cantaloup, melon, levures saisons bien acidulées et bien sur ce miel qui vient adoucir le tout. Cest frais et tous les bons côtés dune bière saison sy retrouvent. En bouche, une belle acidité juste assez citronnée se propage rapidement sur le palais. Un peu de gazon frais, foin et le miel qui arrive par la suite pour donner au liquide une touche plus ronde et sucrée. Une finale qui laisse le melon et cantaloup saffirmer. La sensation en bouche est superbe. On a ici une bière saison qui a à la fois une texture assez mince mais qui possède un corps bien rond. Les saveurs sont intenses et leurs transition sont impeccables.

Tasted from bottle. Pours hazy yellow with thick rocky white head. Aroma is lemon, citrus, grass, herbs and yeast. Taste is mild sweetness with mild to moderate tartness. Flavors of lemon, grass, crackers, Belgian yeast, hay, and other citrus flavors. Lot of lemon. Definitely one of my favorite Hill Farmstead Saisons I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 mL bottle poured into a taster. No bottle date.
 Light golden body with an enormous head. The bottle was a bit of a gusher, so Im not so surprised. Excellent lacing.
Strong yeast. Light acidity. Honey. Pale malts and some spice. Bready.

Lemon tartness right up front. Then lightly sweet bready malts. Pale malts less prominent in comparison to the bread flavors. A touch of honey. Less intense spice aspect, but still really yeasty.
Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation, despite the gushing. Good and easy drinking.

I wasnt impressed with the older versions of this beer, but it has become one of my favorites.
Poured from a 750ml bottle, thanks Tejas/Daniel. Light sweetness, lemon, dusty, honey. This is an amazing beer.
Clear golden with a fizzy white head. Aroma is saison yeast, lemon, citrus. Sweet and a bit tart, very delicious stuff, maybe my favourite HF saison. Fantastic

Magnum shared by Adam C on 7/25/15. Dont remember the date, but I assume its around one year, give or take a few months.Perfect hazy sunset colored body has a perfectly well-retained white head atop.Not-quite-sulfur "stinkiness" in the nose is delightful and quickly joined by floral notes and very light white and black pepper phenols. Not as acidic as Arthur in either aroma or flavor, though perhaps not quite the depth and power of Arthur in the aroma. No alcohol noted, nor flaw.Playful acids are gentle and joined by just a touch of orange blossom-like honey notes. Honey is fully fermented and sits in the background, adding just a touch of stickiness, and its trademark fermentation characteristics of pepper and vanilla. Incredibly soft, gentle texture leads to very light lactic character on the end. Notes of ripe pluots and other dry stone fruits keep things incredibly bright. In the end, just a bit lighter and yet more reserved/sublime than Arthur. Perfect carbonation and mouthfeel, perfect attenuation levels.

Pours light yellow with a big pillow white top. Aroma is sweet honey, floral and dry yeast. Taste is dry on the palate, slight sweetness from the honey, nice yeast that creates a bit of farmy age. Thanks to Deuce for this.

Bottle dated "2015 05 14"
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a hazy burnt golden yellow to orange color with slim fingers worth of foamy white head that dissipated within less than thirty seconds leaving some light rings of lacing.
The smell starts off with an eloquent sweet floral setting leading into a smooth sweet honey and a light underscore of spice to balance. Light citrus also makes a light presence.
The taste was mainly sweet through the floral and the honey adding a bit of grassiness underneath. Theres no aftertaste but a light sweet floral finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a pretty good sessionability about it. Carbonation runs fairly smooth. Light sweet floral tones hit my tongue in a refreshing manner.
Overall, what a wonderful saison that I would love to have again.
backlog. bottle. Citrus yellow, fluffy head. Aroma is grassy, lemony. Palate is crisp, same HF feel to every brew, that awesome citrusy character. Another winner from Shaun.

Bottle, sent by Adam. Thanks!

A: Cloudy gold with a huge white head. Just enormous.

N: Lemon rind, funk, peppercorn, straw, some husk, earth, coriander, and leaves. Theres also no mistaking the HF yeast in this one, even if I cant always identify its complexities,

T: Tart. sweet. and a touch bitter.

M: Foamy carbonation, light body, no alcohol.

O: A pretty nice saison. Easy drinking all around with the complexity to match.
750 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with a large white head. A big sweet fruity hay yeasty nose. The flavor is citrus, lemongrass, perfume, banana, pepper. Smooth. Good.
Pours glowing golden yellow with white head. Smell is sour funk, fruit, yeast, cherry and bread. Taste is sour and dry with notes of fruit, yeast and cherries. Light body medium carb.

Pours hazy yellow, with a fluffy white head. Aromas of lemon, orange, citrus, flowers. Taste is really nice, with sour and hoppy notes at first, lemon and orange, followed by some spices and herbal, flowery notes, and some honey and sugar at the back. Aftertaste is excellent, medium sour. Light body, really refreshing and easy-to-drink, with medium carbonation.

Poured from bottle dated 5/14/2015. Well balanced and smooth. Just a touch of honey, very drinkable. Great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured a very nice gold color. Very sweet fruity aroma. Sweet and mildly spicy flavor. It has a rather sweet aftertaste. Body is pretty smooth and just a little creamy.

Poured from 750ml bottle dated 3/15. Light golden color with a one finger dissapating white head. Aromas of tart rustic funk yeast and hint of honey. Taste is brett yeast hops and honey with a balanced lingering spice note. Quite a nice brew.
Sampled from bottle @ RBBSG 2015. Hazy pale yellow color, small white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, mostly wheat, lemon, lime, citrussy, lightly grassy. Average body and firm carbonation. Meh.
Bottle at RBBSG, thanks for sharing Youri. Quite sour, brett?, honey not noticeable, hoppy, crisp and clean. Very nice.

Bottle, shared with Parksy and others, sent by JulienHuxley-- thanks! A near gusher, this is one lively pour! Hazy golden body with a generous white head that laces thickly as it recedes. Lovely tart, funky profile, with rustic yeast character and gentle honey undertones without heaviness or sweetness. Tart, dry, and exceptionally drinkable despite its complexity. Fantastic. Thanks again Julien!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Aroma is funky. Hazy straw color with white fluffy head. Crisp clean palate. Taste is overall balanced with sour and tart notes. Lemon and pale malts are most dominant. Nothing is over done leaving this balanced and drinkable.

Draft at Eulogy. Very hazy straw pour with a good tuft of frothy white foam. Fair amount of lace. Complex honey sour. Blonde caramel malts. Bright amber fruits. Apricots. Orange passionfruit. Clementines. Floral and herbal elements. Chamomile. Lemon thyme. Dried lemon and orange peels. Just a slight bit of hop bite and Brett funk. Full honey citrus sour. Not quite traditional but a really tremendous Farmhouse!
Bottle thanks to Andrew. Golden with white head. Aroma is peppery, lemon. Taste is very peppery, spices, lemon. Dry and sour.

Hethan at City Swiggers cracked open a bottle to share. A soft cloudy dull yellow color. The aroma offers a hint of honey, with a sour note. Hops act in concert with complex yeast notes, malt, and faint honey. Quite tart, nice sourness. Refreshing, delicious. Sourness is in balance and not over aggressive. Clean finish. Very fine beer.

Fresh bottle. Pours a beautiful straw color with a two finger, white head. Smells of HF yeast, a hint of honey. Lightly tart with a touch of sweetness from the honey. Fresh and bright. Absolutely fantastic.
Cloudy straw color. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit and lemon. Flavor is extraordinarily well balanced. Overall very good.
MrOrla meets Shaun HIll. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma and taste Brett, Yeast, funk, hops. Very well done!
750ml bottle pours a golden color with a lot of frothy head. Nice saison flavors at the start but some harsher flavors come through at the end.

From bottle at Fredfest. Pours murky golden with a thin but attractive white head and a fruit and ueast aroma. There is a smooth and mellow pale malt and fermented honey flavor with a carbonated slightly sour finish.
Shared with the crew @ brickstore. Been waiting to drink this one for a bit. Light tart, lemon, some citrus, a bit funky, brett, floral. Really nice and clean.

Bière brassée à la mémoire dAnna; je serais plus quhonoré que lon brasse un jour une telle bière en mon honneur. Au simple transfert de la bouteille au verre, on sait immédiatement que lon a affaire à une bière brassée avec savoir: celle-ci annonce un corps complexe où dinnombrables particules en suspension colorent le liquide trouble, doré et laiteux. La tête est absolument sublime de beauté: onctueuse, éclatante comme le soleil de midi, généreuse... monarchique! Levures sauvages au nez qui rappellent un peu la souche brettanomyce mais mieux balancées et beaucoup plus douces quune bière typique brett. Ici le nez est délicat, sauvage, aérien. En bouche le côté levuré sauvage est bien moins présent quau nez. Cest délicat, soyeux et les saveurs de jeunes céréales et de citron se mêlent parfaitement au miel de trèfle qui ajoute une magnifique profondeur tant au niveau des saveurs que de la texture générale. Anna, je taime.

Location/Date:Bottle on 2/14/2015 shared with Dave.
Appearance: Pours a yellow cloud.
Aroma: Aroma mostly of honey.
Taste: LIght saison, sweet honey.
Palate:Medium light body.
Summary: My first taste of Hill Farmstead! A pretty interesting saison, honey is a nice touch.

Many thanks to Ron for providing the bottle.

Sunny yellow color, with a decent, bubbly, white head.

Smells of funky yeast, crisp citrus and floral, matured hops. Tartness is well pronounced, entangled in straw and honey, acting as an interesting counterpart to the acidic lime.

Has a pleasant, fitting, lively carbonation with a versatile, decent body.

Tastes of lemon peel, hay, floral, slightly herbacious hops, exhibiting a pleasant bitter note among spritzy, refreshing tartness. The beer got a great complexity to it, revealing a honeyed note, juicy lemon and green apple peel, blending incredibly well into the sour, well balanced base of the brew. Finishes with a pleasant dryness among wheat, soft yeast and a sour tartness, balanced by slightly biscuity malts.

Again, I am truly surprised by Hill Farmstead, creating a beer full of many different layers of flavor on top of its tart, refreshing foundation. Honey is present on its own, highlighting the citrus and floral hops, without overpowering the beers acidic character. Very refreshing, sessionable, with an enjoyable complexity to it, convincing by its balance.

Found myself wondering why HF beers are given peoples first names. Apparently it is a tribute to the owner/head brewers relatives - interesting! This is a yeasty, funky saison. There is cider and a dash of honey in the flavor. There are different flavors at work here - some sourness and bitterness, but nothing overwhelms. Nice.
light sour barnyard aroma,pale, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, dry barnyard finish.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with high white head. Very nice lacing. Aroma is of fruits, citrus, bretts, rustic yeast. Taste is of acidity. fruits, citrus, bretts, lemon. Palate: Light-medium body, soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Quite good. Nice rusticity. Interesting lemon.
Light yellow coloured and unclear. Has a white head, medium duration. Nice aroma, yeasty, light sweet, light acid. Flavor starts sweet, then acid, a bit thin.
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Great aromatic hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Citrus. Average light bitter finish. Oily palate.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lemon and bretty. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270315

Bottle @ Johns. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of light malt, yeast, brett, honey, light fruit, flowers. Flavor is light sour, malt, yeast, brett, light honey, flowers, citrus, lemon. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation, light tart finish. 270315

Bottle, 6.5%. Hazy yellow with big white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, brett, lemon, yeast, spices and tart. Flavour is malt, fruit, lemon, brett, spices, medium dry, notes of honey, little acid, spices and medium bitter.
Bottle. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are honey, pepper, grass, brett, flowers, straw, malt and hops. Nice.

An unbelievable saison! Damn! The pour is a clear golden, yellow with an incredible aroma of honey, straw, yeast, and floral, fruity hops. Very refreshing and vibrant. Fruity, honey, straw, very crisp and delicious. Some funk and tartness.  Another killer beer from HF!

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2015 My second HF saison, and I continue to be unimpressed. Yes, its clean and nice and inoffensive, but man does this bore the hell out if me. Tastes like brett, super dry, very little flavor otherwise from the malts. Very light bodied almost to the point if watery. Its just fine and inoffensive, but Ive yet to find much more overrated than this. Hand me a Tank 7 off the shelf, please.

Purchased bottle at brewery. Pours with frothy head that quickly dissipates. Golden-yellowish color. Lemony, grassy aroma. Certainly has a sour tastw one would expect with a saison but with a honey-sweet finish. Lightly carbonated and crisp on the tongue. Enjoyable.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma is cereal and pislner malts, wheat, honey, and some grassy notes. Flavor is crisp malt profile, grassy and floral notes, fresh citrus, and a hint of sourness. Light/medium body and crisp mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours clear golden, large white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is dusty, floral, citrus, lightly funky. Flavor is dry, light tart, light funk, highly quaffable. Lightish body, champagne like carb.

Bottle cheers to Rob. The thing that stands out to me in this is the huge amount of bitter lemon. It is so zesty and vibrant with this amazing linear sourness throughout but that lemon note just tops it off. Stunning beer

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 Bottle shared with friends. Thanks Ben. Aroma: lemon, barnyard from the brett, floral. App : hazy pale with white minimal head. Taste and palate : medium body, light acidity finish. Overall: really refreshing. Not too much acidity. Really well balanced and easy to drink.

(750ml bottle @ Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade, shared with my girlfriend Jan 8 2014) Ppours a light hazy straw gold with a huge white bubbly head, gusher. Holds a ring and leaves lace. Aroma is complex funky saison, honey and florals prominent and gorgeous. Sourish citrus flesh, wheat malt, fresh grass, soft barnyard, touch of fresh Parmesan. Overall impression is sweet tart. Palate surprisingly sour and orange flesh driven. Yeasty farmhouse funk and grass abundant. Bit of floral honey. Lemongrass. Unripe pear. The sourness fades promptly into dry bitterness. Cut wildflowers, leafy, hay, in the finish along with a citrus tart acidity, pomelo bitterness. Fairly light crisp body with high but soft carb. Really nice stuff indeed, its almost delicate and yet there is a lot of character to it that you can explore.
Way sour - whitch is what I want. Barman who recommended was right. This is the best saison I have had.
Bottle..Pour is golden with a bubbly head..Nose is spice, sweet honey, oak..Taste is oak, spice, honey, sweet, dry..

[Bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o j&m] Pours a hazy pale gold with an average size lasting fizzy white head. Nice aroma of yeast, pepper, citrus and bready malt. Flavour is tart first, then yeasty, herbal and spicy along with a good amount of citrus. Tart spicy finish. Medium bodied. Fantastic stuff.

Nearly crystal clear at first with a light hue and a frothy white head, until you hit the yeast sediments of the bottle. Basement, barnyard, farm aromas with notes of fresh grass, floral fresh fruity notes with a hunch of flower-honey, pretty complex aroma profile. Tangy, effervescent texture, light bodied and refreshing. Developping a fine sweetness, pronounced acidity with a soft bitterness. Long dry/tart finish.

[6948-20141204] 750mL bottle. Mild orange yeast aroma. Hazy, pale yellow orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Soured orange yeast and mild cheese flavour. Medium body has a simple sour base. Average, might be a little old. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5
(w/ blankboy, GregClow, HogTownHarry, jercraigs)

Bottle. Pours orange yellow with thick white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is strong saison yeast, peppery notes and clove. Taste is light, tart, pepper, refreshing, palate cleansing. Really nice saison.
Sample from a bottle atCAH. Thanks, Corrie. Nose is acetic acid like white wine vinegar. First sip is beautiful balance of wheat, barley, target and fresh hops. Finish is start and dry. Lovely beer .

Pour hazy crisp yellow, with a small foamy white head. 
Aroma of citrus, slight white pepper, some soapy mineral stuff, honey.
Taste is a little tart, with a faint bitterness. 
Average bodied, with a fizzy carb.

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 Thanks to Ryan for sharing this at my place a few months back. From notes. Appearance: Hazy straw-gold, frothy white head, good lacing. Aroma: lemon, mineral, pepper; armpit. Taste: lightly sweet honey, otherwise slightly tart, slightly funky, dry mineral finish. Palate: Medium- body (a little thin); slick texture. Long pear juice lingers with lightly bitter finish. Overall: continuing the theme of "solid, nice saisons that dont change my world the way the Vermont deity is supposed to." Good, better than most, but doesnt approach the best Ive had from say, Fantome (though heads and shoulders above the worst Fantomes, too, so obviously not a good comparison). Still, quite good.   bottle again tonight. Nothing that I disavow in the last rating, but it gels more this time. These beers do better in isolation, in my opinion. Bumping from 3.8 to 3.9 (could be 4.0+, but will need more samples).

750ml bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. 171214.


First Hill Farmstead to me. Fresh aroma with some honey. Pale yellow colour. Fresh tart flavour.
Tastes amazing. Clean and bright and tart, incredible flavor. The tartness eases over subsequent sips to reveal the mellow sweet flavor of Vermont honey.

Having never had a Hill Farmstead beer, Im pretty stoked about this one. Large sample pour of bright honey yellow with a full white head. Nose is lemon and citrus with a nice light grassiness an a little funk. Flavor is citrus and very clean, bright and refreshing with light funk notes in the back, but mild. Very amazing

2014-12-04. Average bodied palate, soft effervescent carbonation. Pretty nice stuff. Bottle via trade with SlovakSniper.

Bouteille 750ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur jaune très pâle voilé, mousse blanche moelleuse laissant une belle dentelle. Taste is quite tart and fresh and has notes of green apples, wheat, lemon juice, hay/straw, weak funky barnyard notes and maybe just a tad of the honey as well. really nice and delicate saison!

Bottle, 75 cl. Pours clear yellow at first, but the sediment makes it appear hazy. Fairly light. Head is big, frothy and white, and looks like whipped egg white. Aroma has lots of fresh fruits, slight elderflower, bitter, grainy malts, fruity esters, slight funk and some bitter hops. bottle from BlackIPA. nose is lightly peppery with a light citrus note. pretty damn good.

28/X/14 - 75cl bottle @ De Hopduvel (Gent) - BB: n/a, bottled: IX/2014 (2014-1273) Thanks to Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!

Bottle shared by Jeff at the Dolphins tailgate. (Fun times...) Snifter pour is golden yellow with haze and a moderate head. Aroma is delightful with honey, pine, wet fresh cut grass, white pepper, and light fruits. The taste is delightful with honey, light slight tart fruits, white pepper, hint of herbs, hint of wild yeasts, and a dry finish. Well carbed, very light body. Just another great HF beer.

shared 75cl 2014 bottle by a friend. poured a light blonde golden clear colour with a white head. citrus, biscuits, elderflower (vlierbloessem), sweet honey, lemons, apricots, flowers, crisp malts, sour citrus, just a little bit tart. lemon zest, man... now its clear to me why people are trading there wives for hill farmstead beer. boy this is top notch! amazing brew! the honey sweetnes, sourness, and flower are so balanced! loved it!
Hazy blond with small white head. Tart floral and hoppy aroma. Tart and flora, a bit too sweet though. A bit more time would do it good.

Bottle sample from notes. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have grass, pale malts, honey, floral notes, some pepper, mild funk, very drinkable saison, enjoyable.

Bottle bought at Mikkeller & Friends Bottle Shop in April 2013. 

Hazy golden with a large white head. Fresh aroma of citrus, grapes, light funk and some light spices. Similar taste. An elegant and nicely drinkable beer. The finish was dry.

October 10, 2014. On tap at M&F.
Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is lemon zest, apricot, black pepper, light grass, light yeast and some funky notes. Taste is light sweet, tart citrus and and spicy yeast notes. Finish is dry, light tart and refreshing. Light bodied, dry mouthfeel, average carbonation.
Tap, gold pour, white head, nose is grassy, taste is lemon, pepper, wheaty, nice

Sample at the 2014 Infected Chimipalooza on 11/01/2014. Hazy pale golden color with a medium white head that diminishes steadily to an outer ring. Short strings of lacing. Sample at first sunday. Solid, delicate light fruit and good yeast. Smooth malt and mouth texture overall. Little bit of wild funky cheese on the finish. Some pepper there as well. Long drawn out and full bodied mouth feel.

Bottle, sample from Bobochamp. Many thanks! Yellow colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Complex aroma of lemon, citrus, honey, flowers and some spices. Sour and refreshing, light sweet notes. Light bitter. Well balanced. Very good.

Bottle split at Bruces pad, big thanks to our host with the most for plucking this particular extra beer from his fridge, 24/10/14.
Hazed orange with a good sized of white head.
Nose is tangy mandarin, spice, citric peel, apricot, straw, lemon rind.
Taste comprises citric peel, tangerine, apricot, spice, citric tinged straw, earthy farm notes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid saison work from the Farm.

text: 75cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2010, with honey, thx alot to Secret Santa!, complex brew, fruity/floral and slightly woody/sour, balanced, cloudy, rocky head, good brew, yet expensive!

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of fruit, yeast and a little barnyard. Its mild, a little sour, a little sweet, medium bitter, crispy. Fresh with a hoppy and sourish finish.

Bottle from Justin D. Pours a pale hazy straw, decent amount of white head. Nose grassy and dry, acerbic, yeast prominent. Palette soft and juicy, with a citric tinge and a warm, round honey character. Sublime and well deserving of its ratings.

On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours a slightly hazy golden with little, white head, some lace and a little film. Lively carbonation. Aroma is wheat, white grape juice and brett. Pours hazy yellow low head

Bottle at Jester King. Golden pour with a white head. The aroma has some nice brett notes as well as some grass and citrus character. The flavor is similar. Tap. Hazy golden bbody with an average, off-white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus and spice. Slightly sweet flavor tha ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A great Saison.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2015 Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of grassy, herbal hops, and funky brett. Dry, slightly tart flavour, with citrus, peach and lots of herbal hops.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma of wheat, honey, bretta, peach, gooseberries. Taste is lightly sour, tart fruity, mellow sweet finish. Body is light and crisp with soft carbonation.

Bottle to tulip; thanks kbudd

After rating my worst ever beer @1.4, Im so happy to transition to this. This is friggin funky...but awesomely funky, orange, wheat and hay. Cloudy yellow with a thin creamy white head. Lemon, funk, tartness, some bubble gum. Awesome...love it.

Big thanks to tom10101, for sending me a bottle of this golden elixir. Cloudy yellow pour, aroma is loaded with citrus smelly feet funk, dry white grapes, grass, wow. Taste is bursting with tart citrus refreshing flavour, with a dry tart refreshing finish, this is so good.
Bottle - Wood, funky citrus and hay. Lots of weird funk. Hazy pale gold with a rich white head. Very bright notes, hay, lemon, herbal and a tartness balanced by a bitterness. Well done.

Side by side tasting of bottled Anna, Florence & Arthur at BBF14. Props to Mike Morse. Thank you!
ANNA: plays on the light floral notes, but especially on the spicy and yeast compared to the other two. 4.1/5
FLORENCE: more zesty lemon with a drier body and a great dry finish, a real thirst quencher. 3.8/5
ARTHUR: fruitiest of the 3, with nice balanced pineapple notes and a tad of the yeasty saison chareter. 4.1/5

Thanks to Mike at Borefts for sharing. Cloudy pale yellow with a good white head. Aroma is funk, lemon zest, peach, tangerine, fresh lime. Light bodied, lightly tart on the palate , very well balanced with a lightly dry and spicy finish. Taste is lemon zest, nectarine, tangerine, peach, sour candy.

At BBF 2014 . 
Pours unclear blonde , small white head . 
Smell is bit bitter . Taste is bitter , green , straight . 
Some malts ( in a bitter way ) . Not to convincing ...

"a fragrant beer...lots of hay/grass/barnyard, some light fruits and spices, and a decent amount of hops, all tied together with a ever so slight funk. Really nice saison from VT, and a great summer beer!"

Bottle from cpetrone-thanks, Chris! Wanted to try this for some time now. Pretty, clear deep straw color. Finger thick slow fading head. Nose of light lemon, limestone minerality, and great farmhouse character. Cracker, lemon pith, lightly tart and mineral finish. Dont get any honey specifically.

Oh how I love saisons...this one is one of the best!!!! Citrus and flora notes, orange blossom comes through as you drink it, Excellent carbonation with slim white head. Such a fantastic refreshing brew. A+++++

BIG thanks to my brother in law for surprising me with this one! It pours a hazy light yellow color with a nice creamy white head. The aroma is tart and funky with strong lactic lemony tangerine, grapefruit and cereal grains. The flavor has more spiciness and mild tartness with tangerine, lemons, stone fruit, creamy lacto, and faint phenolic funk in the aftertaste. High carbonation. Mouthwateringly dry and tart in the finish. Not all that complex, but light bodied, refreshing and super tasty. Killer.

Bottle. Clear straw yellow pour with a fluffy white head. Enticing lemon, yeast, and mild barnyard aromas. Lemon and floral notes dominate with mild honey, biscuit, and barnyard undercurrents. Full bodied with a pleasant mouthfeel. Citrus backbeats. Complex and tasty. Everything a saison should be........

Bottle, thank you Lukaduke!! Oh man, once again words fail me. Typical world-class HF saison, serious spotlight on the honey. Aroma is near-perfection for a saison -- spicy, yeasty, funky, slight hops in the back. Honey is spotlighted on the taste but in a way thats unique and impressive. Theres a focus on the honey flavors but its gently enveloped in a beautiful, traditional saison. Obviously unlike any honey beer Ive ever had to this point. Why do I live so far from Hill Farmstead, this troubles me constantly!
Hazy yellow pour. Small white head. Little lacing. Malty aroma. Citrusy. Taste is the same with a tartness.
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear yellow pour with a thick white head. Aroma of funk, lemon and malt. Malty flavor with lemon juice sourness before an herbal an sour finish.
Cloudy gold wih thick foamy lacy white head; aroma is sweet yeasty malty funky; Flava is tart yeasty tart; feels light little fizz; finishes dry tart
Smooth porter. Very competent and drinkable. The above is true, nothing is outstanding. Most taste in the end of bottle sediment.

Bouteille 75cl, courtesy of and shared with Sarro. Dorée-paille, col épais blanc.
Arôme offre un mixe intéressant au niveau levure avec dun côté ce rappel de brett avec un petit ajout plus rustique de Fantôme laissant ainsi une signature belge. Bouquet houblonné reste discret tout comme lajout mielleux.
Palais est superbe alliant encore une fois un clin dil Fantôme (surtout dans ce profil épicé-levure)avec une once de douceur mielleuse. Pointe épicée, pour une belle effervescence et un fruité citronné. Malt pâle complété par un houblonné noble légèrement fleuri.

Poured from a 750 mL bottle dated 05/2014. 
Aroma is rather floral with a nice light cracker and biscuit graininess. Moderate floral notes with hints of citrus and honey. Flowers are orange blossom and wildflower. Some light stone fruit notes present as well and hints of peppery phenolics and grains of paradise. 
Pours a pale, hazy, straw colored, yellow gold with a big, fluffy white head of moderate thickness. Moderately high lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly tart with some lemon and orange notes. Light sweetness with a hint of cracker and grain. Some stone fruit notes along with a touch of overripe tropical fruit. Medium light floral notes and some light honey character. Finish has a bit more acidity and citrus with a light phenolic note of coriander and grains of paradise. Light mineral character from otherwise soft water. Medium light bitterness.
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium carbonation and a bit of a silky softness to it. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, another really nice saison from Hill Farmstead. I was expecting something with a ton of honey character, but I was pleasantly surprised. Lots of citrus and floral character with a nice balanced phenolic note in the background. Good fruit esters in the aroma and flavor.
Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of wheat, funk, citrus, lemon peel. Taste is tart, funky, grainy wheat and lemon peel. Fantastic!

Bottle share: Pours a nice golden hue with a big fluffy head and very good lace. Notes of mild citrus, wild honey, spices, clean wood, flowers, faint barnyard and some lasting smooth bitterness as well as some acidity that counteracts the honey sweetness. Well balanced and easy drinker but would say it did not quite meet lofty expectations.
Wonderful farmhouse aroma, a bit of funk and lemon zest. Very sweet thanks to the honey, maybe a bit too sweet. Nice sudsy mouth feel.

Bottle shared by Bruce at the epic. Aroma is lemonade, grains, and light floral. Pours hazy yellow with a nice fizzy thick head. Taste is lemon zest, sweet honeysuckle, slight pepper, nice grains and a dry citrus finish. A little sweet but still just a fantastic powerhouse of a saison. Loved it.

750mL Bottle. Pretty hazy yellow pour with a fluffy white head. Wonderful aroma of new mown hay and lemon. Nice bready sweetness, with soft carbonation and pleasing citric flavors. Outstanding Saison.

Bottle. Beautiful fairly hazy golden pour with a small thin head. Nose has citrus, funk, and some exotic fruits. Taste has green apple skin, even more citrus, some sweet notes and a nice tartness. Really good!
Bottle. Very yellow pour with white head. Light citrus, Brett and yeast aromas. Dry but rich, citrus and Brett and , wow.

Bottle 750 ml. Shared by Tom10101, thanks! Pours hazy blond with golden reflect. Small off white head. Good lacing. Aroma and taste arefruity and floral. Nice complexity. Refreshing and drinkable. Outstanding saison!

750ml bottle. Cloudy pale yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are dough, cereals, lemon, yogourt, funk, honey and spices with herbal notes. Light body, moderate to high carbonation, creamy texture.

Thanks to some peeps in SoCal for this bottle. Mucho Gusto

Bright, cloudy yellow pour. Quite hazy in the glass. White head with streaky lacing. 
Nose is full of funk, acid, white pepper, and floral notes. 
Taste is full of vinegar and funk. Does separate between a sour and a saison well. White pepper spice and fresh, vibrant floral notes. Crisp dry finish with the honey. Slightly more body than expected. 
Solid as hell beer
Pours a cloudy bright golden color with light fizzy white head. Barnyard funk, yeast, and hay on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a slightly sweet note.

Gold pour, very slight gush when opening. lemon, barnyard funk and leather in the aroma. Honey balances out some of the funkiness in the taste, but its still there. Lemon, citrus rinds, horseblanket. Lighter body.

Bottle BIG thanks to whomever sent this one my way. Pour has a clean golden color with a thick one plus finger white head that slowly fell back. Aroma has honey, hay, mild hops, dampness, and a faint hit of dry citrus. Mouth feel is medium and the carbonation strong. Flavor takes an interesting direction change with tartness, funk, and citrus leading the way. Very farmhouse with a complementing yeast while being extremely drinkable and smooth. The honey adds a slight bit to the flavor but it leads to a fullness rather than a sweetness.
Bottle share pour at DL. Yellow pour. This is a pretty sour brew. Not my fav.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Taste at DLD. Pours a hazy yellow straw color. Aroma of Brett and dusty cobwebs. Bright and slightly citrusy. Dryish finish with some honey taste. 

Re-rate on my deck. Taste is much more sour than the last time. Cleaner with a mineral finish.
Sampled at the DLD bottle share. Slightly tart peppery saison. Decent but not worth the HF hype factor.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2014 Bottle: Cloudy, vivid-yellow body with a chunky & foamy white head that puffs up & retains itself nicely. Lovely aroma; classic saison musty funk, mild damp cheesecloth & dusty cobweb notes with a whole different tartness angle in the form of mild lemon zest, stone fruit, & sweet honey. Smells sharp, crisp, lightly tart, & full of funk. Taste has lots of lemon flesh & lemon rind up front, hitting with ample candy-like tartness followed by a yeasty & musty funk that comes into play; reminders of a damp cellar floor & funky cotton blanket. Notes of hay, straw, & lovely stone fruit flavors collide in the back-end, finishing with a hint of tartness... Very dry, funky, & super-light on the palate. Effervescent. I was really blown away by this, drinkability is off the charts. So nice & refreshing. Upper echelon, fantastic.
Big thanks to tectactoe again. Easily one of the best saisons Ive ever had. Big grassy smell. Big lemon citrus. VERY refreshing.

750 ml bottle thanks to 46er3498. Shared at Jeffs. Pours a hazy yellow with bubbly, foamy head that lingers a while. Leaves some soapy lacing. Aromas are black pepper, musty yeast, lemons, and sweet candy. Tastes like sweet tart candy mixed with honey, black pepper, flowers, and yeast. Light tartness in the finish. Possibly my favorite Saison Ive had.

Pour is hazed golden color with a tight white head. Nose has a strong floral note, faint honey, juicy notes and light sweetness. Taste is very nice, floral up front like Clara, juicy bright fruits as the well carbonated finish brings in the sweet honey balance. Very tight and balanced, nice dusty quality mid palate from the Saison yeast with an interesting sweetness of honey in the finish.

Sample from bottle at Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, thanks for sharing JulienHuxley! Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma has sweet citrus, fruitiness, peach, spices and some malts. Taste has peach, apricot, quite fruity, some spices, a soft sourness, soft bitterness and a little bit of funk. Medium body and carbo. Nice stuff.

Sample bottle @nieuwjaarsborrel. 
Thin white head. Hazy golden blond pour. A nice sason.

Bottle courtesy of JulienHuxley at Mr Hangovers 2014 Nieuwjaarsborrel, Den Haag. Poured a hazy medium to light amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is big yeast zesty citrus light acid. The flavour is medium sour with a lovely smooth slightly dry acid palate. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Full of zesty fruit flavours!

Bottle @ Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, courtesy of JulienHuxley. Slight gusher. Pours a hazy golden beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is slightly sour, slight peppery saison notes. Flavor is light sour, typical saison with a bit mellowed pepper in the background. Short, slight watery finish. Decent saison, not overly impressive.

Bottle @ nieuwjaarstasting. Aroma is tangerine, orange, manderine, lemon, some peppery and yeasty notes. Touch of flowers. Very nice. Flavour is dry and fruity, light citric touch, some pepper. Great! Long lasting tangerine lemon finish with some pepper.

Bottle shared at Nieuwjaarsborrel thanks to JulienHuxley. Pours cloudy golden with a big white head. Aroma of light funk, citrus, peppery saison yeast, citrus and a little grass. Flavor is light sweet, light moderate bitter and acidic. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Bottle at Nieuwjaarsborrel. Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is citrus, yeast, grassy, some pepper and floral. Taste is moderate bitter, light sour and some sweetness. Medium bodied. Great saison. Very smooth and silky. Long fruity finish.

Bottle @ Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, hosted by MrHangover. Hazy light yellow pour. Aroma of spices, fruity with some citrus and lemon peel. Flavor is very smooth, slightly sour, spicy and very full bodied. Well balanced. Very nice brew.

Bouteille 750mL (Batch novembre 2013). Blonde trouble avec mousse blanche. Nez citronné et levures sauvages. Bouche de citronnelle, levures sauvages et un peu de barrique. Celles bues en 2012 avaient des notes de miel de trèfle que je ne détecte pratiquement plus... elle semble plus sèche en finale que mon souvenir.
At c&g tasting. Pours creamy wheat cloudy. Taste is wheat sweet hay, raw wheat.

Yum yum yum. Taste begins with the eyes, and this one looks just as effervescent and delicious as you can imagine. Nose is yeasty, citrusy, and champagne like. Taste is sweet and dry at the same time, extremely intricate and complex, the yeast does tend to take over slightly and become sour towards the finish. So good.

From the 12/2013 3R6P gathering +++ Sampled from a 750 ml brown bottle this beer poured a very cloudy yellow color with a large soapy white head that lingered and left a bit of lacing. The aroma was sulfur, bread, tart lemon and Pez. The flavor was tart and dry with notes of pepper, lemon, chalk, Pez and bread dough. Long dry and tart lemon finish. Medium body. Meh.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2017 Bottle thanks to Pier-Luc, thanks a lot! Pours a nice and slightly hazy golden and is topped by a medium white head that leaves intense lacing. Nose is of spicy honey, citrus and wheat. Taste is lightly tart, carrying fresh cereals flavors along with citrus. Some rusticity. Body is light, mouthfeel borders on juicy. Really nice and refreshing. Great!

Edit, 2017-06-06: Bumping to 4.4 from 4.1. Lots of white wine and just an all round super nice barrel/foudre aged saison! I need to stock up on these soon! I could certainly drink that and only that (OK, maybe not :P) for the rest of my life!
Sample at Blue monk. Thanks swoopjones. Hazy yellow pour with a thin white head. Sweet floral aroma with citrus all over. Taste is funky citrus sweetness with some hay and funk. Outstanding.
bottle from HF, blonde yellow pour . tons of citrus pith, citrusy zest. acidic tartness, not a ton of honey, very citrusy tartnes, pith & peel. still really damn good
Bottle via Derek. Thanks! Very light hazy gold, white head. Nose is lemon pith, floral, citrus, light sugar. Amazing. Flavor is lemon, lemongrass, some really nice acidity. Clean lemony finish.

750ml bottle pours cloudy yellow gold with big 2 finger head. Nose is bright fruity yeast and citrus, some earthy hay. Taste is wonderful mild tart citrus, grain, pear, clementine, fruity. Finish is soft tart earthy orange, pear, citrus, very subtle honey notes linger as it warms. So good!

Bottle from International Trade; cloudy straw yellow pour with frothy white head, sweet honey aroma, sweet taste of honey, with a hint of funk, brett, lemon, citrus, malty backbone, very clean and crisp taste, rewarding.

Bottled: unk
ABV: 6.5%

Pours a light crisp yellow hidden beneath a persistent finger of white billowy foam. Brilliant clarity. The ale yeast dominates the nose with hints of apples and coriander. The nose also has some lemon and the slightest honey note. Flavor is crisply saison with a good bittering addition of hops and some sweetness from the yeast it seems like. There is an industrial flavor on the beer I cant quite place, not unpleasant. Good long musty finish. The beer is thin with high and lively carb with a watery finish. Good stuff. Not sure I can taste the honey as much as others can, but a solid beer nonetheless.

Serving type: bottle

02-20-2012

Clear, light straw color with fine, pillowy white head. Aroma of spent fireworks, slight funk, spice and slight honey essence. Mouthfeel is flat, water-like, and the body is bigger than the appearance led me to expect. Has a somewhat palate cleansing affect, with a very slight amount of tartness. Finishes very dry. This is unique, and a very nice saison for my palate.

From a bottle
Pours a blonde color with a good head and nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is peppery & floral with a very mild funk and is nicely earthy. Its hard to describe but its got a strange but wonderful bouquet. 

The beer is very satisfyingly dry, nicely tart with plenty of earthy and peppery notes. Some good fruit expression of pear and apricot... just really very bright and really very easy to drink. 

The palate is lively, and light (in the good sense)

Bottle: &nbsp Bright straw, large foamy white head, nice lacing. &nbsp Big sharp tart and wheaty nose, slightly funky, barnish, and floral. &nbsp Smells great! &nbsp Even sharper on the tongue. &nbsp Fairly dry, super tart, wheaty, did I mention dry? &nbsp Probably one of the best Saisons I have had. &nbsp A bit rustic, but sweet. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel, bubbley too. &nbsp A little unripened apple/pear skin on the exit. &nbsp Finishes dry, tart, very tart, wheaty, with soft barn and floral notes. &nbsp Musty too. &nbsp Great example of the style!

75cl bottle at home, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: slight gusher! light clouded blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: very nice IPA nose for a saison? slight pepper, hoppy, slight white wine nose even, little sour, somewhat sweet. Amazing nose!!
TASTE: sweet, hoppy, fruity, somewhat sour.
Very good beer!

No head left, orangeish to straw-coloured, fully hazy beer. Flowers, citrus (lemon), dandelion, hay, sourish nose. Very dry to even astringent mouth, with citrus (again mainly lemon), USA-type Bretts; flowery character and a hint at sweetness in the finish. Dry lemon cake. Very highly carbonated, light to medium bodied, close to dry-out effect. Superb balance. Comparable to a great lambic (despite the Wyeastlabs Bretts), but NOT to a Saison, sorry.  Many thanks to late night MLDeliveries!

Bright hazy, sun colored pour with a white head. Nose is fresh and bright with a beautiful and light integration of light fruit and dry grains. Flavor is tight and well integrated, dry, with apple and pear, unfolding with a kiss of honey on the finish. Wonderfully dry and bright with a lot of great stuff going on.

Sample from bottle at tasting. Semi hazy golden pour, rocky white head. Aroma of melon, honey and brett. Flavors of grain, lemon, hay, tartness, floral honey, funk, and green apple. Fairly dry overall, complex and delicious.
Shared with timfoolery. Some floral notes, honey, brett, a little tart. Very good saison.

750 mL bottle courtesy of deekyn, thanks! Poured into my Duvel tulip. Opaque goldenrod with a humungous white head, leaving chunks of lacing and displaying good retention. Aroma is unripe clementines, wild oats, honey, white grapes, slight horseblanket, dust, slight copper. Some really intriguing and complex stuff going on here, although I found the copper/metallic note to be unwelcome. The flavor is highly lemony and acidic as it strikes the tongue but smoothes out as the beer moves across the palate. There it reveals a nuanced honey sweetness with floral accents, Meyer lemon and key lime tartness, and a bretty finish with a honeycomb note and a tinge of sour and bitter. Quite nice.

Bottle from Mikkeller Bottle Shop the day after CBC 2013. Pours golden hazy into the glass with a white light foam that dissappears quite fast.
Balanced taste that's not that funky. I can't detect the honey by taste, but it's there in the aroma. Like it a lot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from HF trade. Aroma and flavor of honey and sour/tart, sorta pineapple. Excellent palate on this one, and round in the middle. Sorta bready. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
If you are unsure what Brett smells like, one whiff of this will set you straight. Honey-grain on the palate initially, finishes dry and Bretty. Tasty.

A corked 0.75l bottle shared with Inbreak @ Mikkeller Bar. A little treat on Mikkeller Bars 3 years anniversary. And its a gusher! The bartender managed to save the most of it though. It pours this deep cloudy honey colored thing with a surprisingly lovely looking and dense bright white head considering the gushing this big girl created. Lovely lacing in the glass as well. Nice aroma, really balanced, I get the saison yeast, heather, a nice sweet almost grassy touch with green apples and apple zest. Lots of subtle and delicate hints here, really integrated and almost impossible to tear apart. Big flavor! Its really gentle and only prickling on the carbonation and the mouthfeel shockingly big and powerful for such a "little" beer. Lovely acidic in the taste. Loads of fresh lemony citrus without going over the top. Slightly dry in a way also, definitely not sweet. Cant sense much of the honey, but it has a lovely floral and slightly earthy hint towards the finish. Pure class, lovely stuff. 05.05.2013

Bomber. Absolutely beautiful golden pour with a shit ton of puffy white head. Retention and lacing is one of the best I have ever seen. Nose is a but funky with lemongrass, citrus, straw, and yeast. Taste is very heavy lemon, lemon zest, lemongrass, and yeast. Nice tart funky finish. Very high carbonation contributes to a fairly light mouthfeel. Good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle from the brewery. Clear yellow color with lasting head retention. Nose is a delicious yeast, wild flowers and honey.Taste is lemon, floral hops grain and fresh cut hay. This has a great carbonation level. The finish is dry with some floral notes and a lingering honey without any cloying affect. Medium body. So easy drinking my glass was empty before I realized. I could drink this all night long.

750 poured into HF stemware. Nice dark yellow, slightly opaque with a massive head. Smell is honey, spice, yeasty, and a little funk. Taste is awesomely refreshing. A bit of honey, peppery spice, slight tartness. Nice dry finish. The body feels super light, while not thin at all. Lovely.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2014 750ml bottle in a HF glass.  Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of honey, some tartness from the yeast, a little caramel and pale malts, and a little bitterness from the hops.  Flavor the same with a good blend of honey and the saison style.  Average texture.  A good saison.  Edit: This is really good.  Wow.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen december 2012. Almost clear golden/yellow beer with a small offwhite head. Sweet hoppy, fruity, floral, sourish and spicy aroma with some grassy notes. Sweet hoppy, sourish a bit vinous, fruity, grassy, grapefruits, raisins, tart and bitter flavour. Really a nice beer :-)
750ml bottle a golden pour with large bright white head. Lemon zest aroma. Funky lemon zest honey and a bit of a floral taste.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty and weak funky spicy aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty funky flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty and slightly tart finish with hints of honey.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 05.05.2013, 0,75l bottle shared with Palme @ Mikkeller Bar 3 year Anniversary:
Frisk lett fruktig lukt med preg av lys malt, humle, gjær, høy, sitrus, kamille, blomster, lyng, urter. Frisk lett syrlig smak med preg av lys malt, humle, syregras, sitrusskal, mild sitron, høy, gjær, tre, blomster, kamille, urter. Frisk, god bitterhet som set litt, lett uttørrande munnfølelse. God.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar. Hazy golden liquid with big white head. Aroma of white pepper, barnyard, lemons, grain, earth and flowery hops. Taste is dry, light sour and light bitter with notes of white pepper, lemons and barnyard. Light to medium bodied with high carbonation. Delicious.

Bottle @ Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy yellow color, medium head. Aroma of belgian yeast, nice flowery hops, bit citrus, hint of honey, grapes. Very nice example of fruity belgian saison. Very well made beer like all Hill Farmsteads Ive had.

Bottle @ mikkeller & friends. Drank all by myself because Im a greedy git.a The pour is hazy gold with a small head. The nose is citrus fruits. Lemon and lime. Hints of banana and honey. Mild tropical funk and soft barnyard yeast. The taste is wonderfully crisp citrus, light lemon. Mild tart sourness. Soft yeasty funk. Just wonderful,y balanced and easy to drink. Light body, fine carbonation. Overall, another great HF beer.
Solid easy drinking matl and herbal hops driven saison right here. Nothing extraordinary but solid.

Bottle at Dark Lord! Pours cloudy pale yellow, bright while head. Lemon zest, funk, yeast, bread and tons of floral notes on the nose. Light, lemon citrus zest and sour funk notes and dry finish. Clean and crisp. Awesome saison.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle Shared by dedollewaitor. Hazy yellow body with a small white head. Aroma is yeast, white wine, funk, fruit. Flavour is yeast, fruity, white wine, funk, honey. Well balanced.

Bottle. Trade with Sean9689.  Thanks. Shared with Hallinghansen. Pours hazy pale yellow with a fluffy white head. White wine, oak, hops and a bit of honey. Some tartness - refreshing. Smooth, crisp and dry.  Wauw.

Apr. 22, 2013: Cloudy, very pale yellow. Unfiltered. Thin head. Extremely-zesty lemon/citrus brew with a long-lasting, sour, "Lemonhead"-type palate. Not a huge fan of this lighter style (the appearance is a bit off-putting?), but appreciate what the brewer has done with this, and am happy to sample one of the better examples.

Bottle. Pours unclear yellow with a good lacing creamy small off-white head. Aroma is lemon, sweet honey, flowery hops, grass, orange and some brett. Taste is light+ sweet, bitter and light tangy. Body is near medium, texture is , carbonation is soft. Finishes balanced and light sour. Absolutely delicious.
Botella. Cloudy goldenish colour. Small white head. Fruity tart piney like aroma. Good mouthfeel.  Fresh fruity tart flavour, piney like,  plesant, bitter, dry.

Bottle. Unclear yellow/orange with a thick really good lacing white head. Aroma is coriander, lime, leather, light barnyard, herbal and flowery, honey, soapy. Taste is medium sweet, light+ bitter with a light sour touch. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Nice filling mouthfeel. Crisp and dry finish with citrus and brett.

Chilled 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip.  Pours golden with big white head.  Big fluffy lacing, medium body, and tart aroma.  Taste is wonderful tartness, will some sweetness, and a touch of honey.  Great Saison.

Bottle @ home ... also had this @ Mikkeller .... she pours murky yellow with a large long lasting white head.... the aroma is bread, sour, citric and fruits... The flavor is sooo nice fresh, critic, sour, light malt and fruity! .. love to meet this lady again some time soon! :)

50th Saison rating. Woohoo! 750 ml bottle thanks to lukaduke. Pours a semi hazy gold, solid white head of foam. The aroma has nice acidity coming through. Funky and bready. Sweet and sour come out in the taste with a lot of fruity acidity. Love this beer!
